body: This wonderful bar of dark chocolate heaven is a close second to my favorite, the Scharffen Berger 70%. They are slightly different with the Ghiradelli having, for lack of a better word, a darker taste. Not richer. Not smoother. Maybe more mellow is a better way to describe it. It's like the difference between a brand new luxurious bedspread that you just brought home and unwrapped and are so excited to see how it looks on your bed ( the Scharffen Berger) and pulling out the comforting old quilt your grandmother made that you've loved your whole life (the Ghiradelli). They are both wonderful, will keep you warm and make you happy. You can't go wrong either way. This chocolate is yummy. If you like dark chocolate, you'll love this one!
title: My Second Favorite Dark Chocolate

body: I like dark chocolate, and I'm fine with chocolate with an even higher cocoa content than these have. Note: 'cacao' (which is on the label) is the original spelling for cocoa and is, in fact, cocoa. I suspect these bars use it to seem more... refined. Anyway, these are 72% cocoa, which is very chocolatey but still sweet enough to appease most who claim to like chocolate. Higher cocoa content will begin to be too bitter/unsweet for most. If someone says they like dark chocolate, these are a good bet to get them, as these are dark enough not to seem too sweet, and yet sweet enough so as not to seem too bitter. They are very smooth-melting and taste fantastic.
title: Dark chocolate, but not *too* dark

body: I have ordered this chocolate from Ghiradelli for several months and was satisfied.  But in my last order I experienced what several other reviewers have described as "old" "had a film on it" or "damaged by heat."  The bars were dry and brittle, had a white film on them and the flavor was definitely compromised.  Hope they can figure out what the problem is so that I can go back to ordering it.
title: Five Stars

body: First order of chocolate bars was thrown out as Amazon combined the chocolate in the same box with a completely separate order that I had placed for liquid household cleaning chemicals.  Amazon customer service was great and shipped another order of the chocolate bars at no charge.  However, the second order of chocolate bars were waxy and the chocolate had no taste.  Not sure if this is because the chocolate was old, was imitation Ghirardelli, or if the bars were exposed to hot temperatures in either the Amazon warehouse or during UPS shipping.  I don't think it is a Ghirardelli problem as I have bought these chocolate bars frequently at a local grocery store and found them to have a rich chocolate taste.  I bought the bars on Amazon as the price was better, but it ended up not being a bargain.  After tasting two bars we put the remaining four bars in the trash.
title: Waxy, no taste

body: Just buy this in store. This is usually a great tasting product, but it tastes awful after having been melted in the UPS box during shipping.
title: Melted = different taste/texture

body: Let it melt in your mouth with minimal chewing for the best flavor. Packed with freezer bags and with very quick delivery, it still wasn't quite enough to withstand the first 100+F degree day in downtown Phoenix and Scottsdale. One bar on the very outside of the stack of 6 bars was clearly melted at some point, and the chocolate oxidized at the very end of the bar, and was hard-textured for the first piece or two, where it re-solidified. I feared this would be the case on the other bars, but it was only minimally the case on the bar right next to the outside one. The rest were fine and delicious. I'm dying to know if the Godiva brand of 70+% cacao chocolate, which sells for about twice the price, is in any way better than this, but I'm seriously reluctant to pay the price to find out. So if anyone has tried both of these, I welcome your opinion about this.
title: Excellent quality - not too sweet or too bitter.

body: I subscribed to this chocolate so that I could eat half of a bar each day to get a good dose of flavanols.  The first three shipments were fine.  I liked the chocolate.  However, in the last shipment each bar had white film on it (fat bloom) and did not taste good.  Since I use it for medicinal purposes, I still ate it every day for a while.  But, I believe it is giving me stomach upset as well.  So, am throwing the rest away and cancelling my subscription.

body: Twilight Delight is my favorite of the Ghiradelli Intense Dark series!  I like the Midnight Reverie, as well, but it borders on too dark for me Twilight Delight is definitely my choice of dark chocolate, and I like being able to purchase the multi pack here on Amazon, so I never run out.
title: Twilight Delight - my favorite of the Intense Dark series

body: These are very good dark chocolate bars, with smooth, rich and intense chocolate flavor, as advertised. I felt a "chocolate buzz" after eating a couple of squares. The taste is only slightly sweet, with a bitter aftertaste characteristic of high cacao content chocolate. The taste is not as creamy as one might expect, given the fat content of 17 grams per 38 gram (1.4 oz.) serving--perhaps because of the bitter taste, and also because there is no added dairy fat. This is a good product for those who wish to avoid dairy and/or gluten, although according to the packaging, traces of dairy may be present. WARNING: consume with care. Both my wife and I experienced slight stomach cramping--me after eating half a bar, and she after eating only 1 square. It's potent chocolate!
title: A potent chocolate bar!

body: After reading about all the benefits of dark chocolate (the bitter cacao bean part, not the tons of sugar, milk, etc added to make it into candy), I found the 72% cacao a good place to start. If sugar is listed as the first main ingredient, then it's candy. Sugar is listed second on these. I plan to move up gradually to the higher percentage flavor eventually.

body: Lindt is a great chocolate bar, but one should be wary of which Lindt bar you choose if you are also seeking the health benefits of eating chocolate.
title: Great Chocolate Bar

body: The 100g (3.5 oz) bars of Lindt Excellence Chocolate labeled simply as, " 70% Cocoa Smooth Dark", "85% Cocoa-Extra Dark", "90% Cocoa-Supreme Dark", and "99% Cocoa Dark-Noir" on their black and white cardboard labels have been *my* go-to chocolates for dessert for more than 5 years. Although dairy and salt are not added, the labels do state, "may contain traces of... milk...."  I've NO need to swallow Lactaid caplets.  I pair a small rectangle of the smooth sweetest bar (70%) with a similar piece from one of the other three; my spouse pairs a rectangle w/ Cab or Merlot wines. As you've guessed, the sweetness decreases and the chocolate taste intensifies as the cocoa percentage increases. The 70% is not cloyingly sweet & I do not find any of these bitter. Unfortunately, DAIRY IS ADDED to ALL OTHER Lindt Excellence chocolates, including 50% cocoa, chili, sea salt, citrus flavors, almond, etc. BTW, I was not paid in any way to promote this delicious product : )
title: _FOUR_ Lindt Dark Chocolate bars that adult-onset lactose Intolerant GI systems may enjoy together

body: I am not sure why so many folks are so bitter about this chocolate. I might not be a chocolate expert, but I definitely love good Swiss chocolate and I think this product is great (even though it is made in the USA - by a Swiss company). This stuff tastes great, is not too bitter for a 70% bar and gives me my chocolate fix without sending me into a sugar shock. The reason it melts in warm weather is because it is real chocolate - that's what it does. Anyhow, wanted to put in a good word for my favorite snack.
title: I like it!

body: I don't know what the low raters are whinging about but I know chocolate. I've had chocolate from all over the world and can tell you this is QUALITY chocolate. The price, calories and fat content nearly killed me. But that's beside the point. I got the 70% and it is wonderful. Enough cocao to be healthy but not so much you want to spit your teeth out.
title: 70% Chocolate; 100% Heaven

body: As an experiment, my family conducted a taste test of six different 70-90% chocolate bars. We concluded that the 85+% were a little too dark for our tastes. In the 70% range, Lindt's came in second place, behind only the 72% Godiva bar. The Godiva is slightly more dark tasting, if you know what I mean, and the Lindt's is slightly smoother. I making this review 4 stars only so I can delineate between it and the Godiva bar. Both are very smooth and delicious, so you can't really go wrong with either.
title: Came in 2nd in taste test

body: Love this 70 % cocoa chocolate as much as life itself!! Arrived with cold packs (reusable) to prevent melting in transit as well as intense insulation. My local Safeway charges $3.99 per bar. This case is $2.41 per bar. Score !!!!!! This is now a permanent part of my survival. The pig-out continues. I will be hiding these from my husband whose middle name is "whole package". I share with him when I eat, bit by bit.
